III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
The facility does not have a DHHS contract and thus is only required to comply with
the administrative rules and applicable statutes.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The facility does not have a contract with DHHS and is only required to comply with
the administrative rules and applicable statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
During the renewal period there was one special investigation.
2018C0220007 12/18/17
A parent complained their child in detention facility was not provided with follow up
medical care, the youth continued to be placed under a suicide watch unnecessarily,
the facility didn't complete an incident when the youth was hit in the face with a volley
ball, and the parent was not provided with a copy of the facility’s grievance procedure.
The allegations of no follow up medical care, unnecessary placement on a suicide
prevention watch and failure to complete an incident report were not substantiated.
Follow up medical care was provided as required. The youth was placed on a suicide
watch for his own safety. The agency documented their attempts to resolve all
grievances received from parents. However, the grievance procedure was not always
provided to parents at intake. The agency immediately corrected this practice to
4

ensure parents are provided a copy of the grievance procedure during the intake
process.
An interim inspection completed 4/5/17 determined the facility was compliant
with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
